I want to say something poignant, but I've basically been left speechless.

Initially I was put off by the stereotypical teenage male in the picture, but then I realized that's probably the face I would make while wearing one as well.

Did anyone read the page?

Let's you experience "Fatigue, irritability, and much, much more!" , and is apparently an amazing teaching tool with "DOMESTIC VIOLENCE PREVENTION" ... buh?

name: belgand
text: If you want to know what it feels like to be pregnant I would suggest a tapeworm. I presume that one parasite feels much like another.

name: tekende
text: Okay, soticoto.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Ha, I read this and chubbied it, just thinking that it's kind of fun going back through the archives and making fun of soticoto comments even though he's long gone (I've done it a few times recently, as well).

And then, even after reading the original post and staring at it for a while, I realized that it wasn't actually a soticoto comment.

That's not a good sign, belgand.

name: soticoto
text:
Ahem.

I, much like herpes, always come back to haunt you.

name: laserblade
text: Now it means "inconsequential fact", too.  Don't act like it doesn't.

name: sid
text: That's a factoid.

name: fermatprime
text: SPLUT!

name: tripleg
text:
Noun: factoid faktoyd
1. Something resembling a fact; unverified (often invented) information that is given credibility because it appeared in print
2. A brief (usually one sentence and usually trivial) news item

name: a_bad_place
text:
One year ago, you set a record straight to the benefit of all, and nobody did anything about it. Today, that's gonna change.

Have a chubby for gettin' your words straight.

text: A comment left by petitegitan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, joeyramoney, kylank)

name: direhaggis
text: The butt is like a fanny pack. Wait, that came out far more lame than I meant.

name: heccibiggs
text: The fact that you can buy something called a "fanny pack" in America is always hilarious to me, because in England, "fanny" cold means vagina.

name: firesign
text: As an American reader, despite my knowledge of this fact, this not-so-subtle difference did lead to some odd automatic interpretations of passages from _Trainspotting_ when I read it...

name: jezebel
text:
Ahahahaha. My dorky-ass father-in-law wears one of those. I am now highly anticipating going on an outing with him so that I might divulge this informational tidbit.

For that future moment, I officially love you.

name: atticusonline
text: Odd, over here fanny cold means ass.

name: rowboat
text: 'Cause fanny means your arse over here. Not your minge.

name: journalclub
text: Chubbied for 'The Office' reference

name: soticoto
text:
Typical backwards americans.

Still... chubby for spelling "arse" correctly, unlike that mentally handicapped fool above you.

name: tellumo
text: I was at a hotel with my brothers (none of whom read Achewood) on a family trip, and one of them was eating pistachios. That made me think of this strip, so I pulled it up and showed it to him. He was hell of puzzled.

name: tellumo
text: Also, I looooove the fact that Philippe recites the disclaimer in panel 8.

name: saint
text: I'm glad someone commented on that. That really struck me funny. At first I thought Phillipe was dancing around and the walk-around butt was singing, so that made it pretty funny, but once I realized the truth...genius.

text: Walk Around Butt 2 will have a special "Run Around" function. V3 will pick up local radio.

text: I think the name "Walk-Around Butt" is just genius. It means nothing . All butts can be walked around in. I think if Onstad gets sick of doing Achewood he could definitely go into inventing and marketing kids' toys, is what I guess I'm trying to say here.
